response.answer_text: Assessment: n. estimating and judging the subsets of a set which are frequently relevant to goal(s) achievement An investment assessment can be made of stocks to determine which ones to invest in if any. Sometimes assessments are made as to the probability of achieving a goal(s) and all the details which go with the achievement. To answer the question -“ Is it worthwhile doing?” , frequently means that one must assess the situation before action is taken.

After getting all the relevant facts together, you take an assessment of what those facts mean or what it all adds up to. In therapy it means going over a person’s relevant issues and assessing what is needed to treat the malady. Basically, it means “adding it all up” then making a decision. The adding it all up is the assessment stage.
